A. 	 Cool the burn : Hold the burned area under 
			 cool (not cold) running water or apply a cool, wet 
			 compress until the pain eases. Do not use 
			 ice. Putting ice directly on a burn can cause 
			 further damage to the tissue.

 B. 	 Apply lotion : Once a burn is completely cooled, 
			 apply a lotion, such as one that contains aloe 
			 vera or a moisturizer. This helps prevent drying 
			 and provides relief.

 C. 	 Bandage the burn : Cover the burn with a sterile 
			 gauze bandage (not fluffy cotton).Wrap it 
			 loosely to avoid putting pressure on burned 
			 skin.Bandaging keeps air off the area, reduces 
			 pain and protects blistered skin.

 D. 	 Take a pain reliever : Over-the-counter 
			 medications, such as ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin IB, 
			 others), naproxen sodium (Aleve) or 
			 acetaminophen (Tylenol, others), can help relieve 
			 pain.

First aid

 A. 		 Keep the person still do not move them unless 
				 there is an immediate danger, especially if you 
				 suspect fracture of the skull, spine, ribs, pelvis 
				 or upper leg.

 B. 		 Attend to any bleeding wounds first. Stop the 
				 bleeding by pressing firmly on the site with a 
				 clean dressing. If a bone is protruding, apply 
				 pressure around the edges of the wound.

 C. 		 For a limb fracture, provide support and 
				 comfort such as a pillow under the lower leg or 
				 forearm. However, do not cause further pain or 
				 unnecessary movement of the broken bone.

 D. 		 Apply a splint to support the limb. Splints do 
				 not have to be professionally manufactured. 
				 Items like wooden boards and folded 
				 magazines can work for some fractures. You 
				 should immobilise the limb above and below 
				 the fracture.

 E. 		 Stop the person from eating or drinking 
				 anything until they are seen by a health care 
				 professional in case they need surgery.

First Aid

 A. 		 Lie the person down. If a limb is injured, raise 
				 the injured area above the level of the person’s.

 B. 		 Get the person to apply direct pressure to the 
				 wound with their hand or hands to stem the 
				 blood flow.If the person can’t do it, apply direct 
				 pressure yourself.

 C. 		 If an object is embedded in the wound, do not 
				 remove it. Apply pressure around the object.

 D. 		 If blood saturates the initial dressing, do not 
				 remove it. Add fresh padding over the top and 
				 secure with a bandage.

Welcome to our SOS application! This user manual will guide you through the functionalities of our app so that you can utilize it effectively during emergencies.

1. Adding Emergency Contacts:

Open the app and navigate to the 
"Add Emergency Contacts
" section.
Add at least one and up to five emergency numbers.
These contacts will receive emergency messages along with your current location during an SOS situation.

2. Managing Registered Numbers:

In the "Contact list" section, view and manage your emergency contacts.
Delete old contacts or add new ones as per your preference.

3. Customizing Emergency Message:

Head to the "Edit Message" section.
Enter a personalized emergency message.
Save the message. This message will be sent to your emergency contacts during an SOS situation.

4. Accessing Helpline Numbers:

Explore the "Helpline" section.
Find essential emergency numbers like ambulance, police, fire services, etc.
Directly call these numbers with a simple tap.

5. First Aid Information:

Access the "SOS Guide" section.
Get instructions for immediate actions to be taken in various emergency scenarios like burns, fractures, etc.

6. Activating Emergency Mode:

Locate the "Emergency Mode" button.
Tap on it to navigate to another activity.
In the new activity, find "Start" and "Stop" buttons.
Press "Start" to activate emergency mode.
Once activated, you'll receive a notification.
During emergency mode, shake your device to trigger an SOS message along with your current location to your registered emergency contacts.
They will be able to track your location and provide assistance.

Remember, our app is designed to provide you with quick and efficient assistance during emergencies. Keep your emergency contacts updated and ensure your personalized emergency message is clear and concise. Stay safe!
